intro: Bactris gasipaes var. gasipaes, commonly known as the piña or sweet banana, is a member of the Arecaceae family. It is a tall, slender palm tree that can grow up to 15 meters in height, characterized by its long, segmented stems and large, pinnate leaves. The plant produces clusters of edible, fleshy fruits that are typically yellow or orange in color. The fruit is rich in carbohydrates and has a sweet, tropical flavor. It is native to Central and South America and is cultivated for both its fruit and ornamental value.
